channel.title: [317 pi] auto cache downloader
channel.description:
im trying to get my client to auto download a cache when there is none so i figure everything is fine in my server, because it recognized i had not cache in my c: drive and i needed to download one, it asked me if i would like to download the latest cache, i accepted and i got this error in my client cmd
[code]C:\Users\Jordan\Desktop\server\client java.net.MalformedURLException: no protocol: www.example.com/clientLinkHere.zip at java.net.URL.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.net.URL.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.net.URL.<init>(Unknown Source) at CacheDownloader.downloadFile(CacheDownloader.java:124) at CacheDownloader.downloadCache(CacheDownloader.java:105) at client.startUp(client.java:7192) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:4658) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) The cache was not downloaded correctly. Please download it manually at: C:/Jay-ScapeV1.zip File Directory: C:/ java.net.MalformedURLException: no protocol: www.example.com/clientLinkHere.zip at java.net.URL.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.net.URL.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.net.URL.<init>(Unknown Source) at Update.downloadFile(Update.java:99) at Update.<init>(Update.java:27) at client.streamLoaderForName(client.java:3575) at client.startUp(client.java:7204) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:4658) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) error [/code]
any idea? i feel like its the problem with the website, like something is blocking it from downloading the cache, idk though...

item.title: [317 pi] auto cache downloader
item.dc:creator: @jwags jwags
item.description:
@jwags wrote:

im trying to get my client to auto download a cache when there is none
so i figure everything is fine in my server, because it recognized i had not cache in my c: drive and i needed to download one, it asked me if i would like to download the latest cache, i accepted and i got this error in my client cmd

any idea? i feel like its the problem with the website, like something is blocking it from downloading the cache, idk thoughâ€¦
